ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would absolutely recommend this course to other students. It gives a wonderful introduction of the Russian 18th-century, and actually makes you think about the further development of Russian literature in a different manner. The course works great as a historical, as well as a literary survey of the period.

Even though it is part of the distribution requirement, I would highly recommend RUS 608 to any aspiring Slavicist. Having very little knowledge of the period prior to the course, the class has given me much insight into the historio-cultural setting as well as the early polemics of this literature. It has also greatly helped my understanding of both 19th and 20th century literature, as well as broadening my awareness of both American and Russian academic scholarship on the subject.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It definitely gave me a valuable insight into my discipline, as it encouraged me to think about the development of Russian literature in a new way. I feel I have a better grasp of Russian literary history at large because of this course. I do not know to what extent the course will be helpful for my research, but it is comforting to know that I no longer have a century-long hole in my knowledge of Russian letters.
